wiki.content: Collaborating with U.S. Georgian native rapper and record producer Quavo amid dating allegations, ”Tough” seems to be the start of the official rollout for Lana’s tenth studio album, aptly known as ’Lasso’ by the media and Lana alike. A tale about difficulties facing both family and drugs, the single is a track of re-insurance, suggesting togetherness no matter how rocky the road becomes As announced back in February 2024, Lana stated to IHeartRadio her desires to foray into ‘western’ genres for this upcoming album; therefore, the western country iconography as seen throughout this track is no surprise here, mentioned primarily through the chorus: Tough like the scuff on a pair of old leather boots Like the blue-collar, red-dirt attitude Like a .38 made out of brass” Although the western theme has been heavily implied to be on the album, whether or not it will be a prevalent theme throughout the album’s narrative remains in ambiguity; Lana reinforced this sentiment within an interview with NME in May 2024: What can I say now? What can I say now? […] When I gave Jack Antonoff his award for best producer of the year and I said “Welcome Nashville to Hollywood, and Hollywood welcome Nashville, ‘cause the music business is gone, gone country” and it went silent, 5,000 people in dead silence; and then the next week, three major artists announced big country albums, so where’s Lasso going? I really have no idea now” Despite this, however, it remains irrefutable that the country influences run rampant through the lyrical content of this single, and although, sonically being reminiscent of her 2017 album, ”Lust for Life”, the country side of this single is undeniable. The song got released the 3rd of July 2024 at 9am PST, the date was shared from Lana’s newsletter the day before. With the release, in his youtube channel, Quavo premiered the videoclip of the song. Read more on Last.fm. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License; additional terms may apply.
